name: NCSU Engineering Summer Program
description: A one-week residential program for high school students to experience different engineering disciplines (Mechanical, Civil, etc.) with NCSU faculty.

name: University Summer Research Program
description: General application for summer research programs at universities like UNC, Duke, or NC State. Highly competitive and research-focused.

name: RTP Technical Internship
description: General opportunity for a summer internship at a tech company in Research Triangle Park (RTP). Often focuses on software, IT, or biotech.

name: Self-Started Tech Project
description: A self-directed project, such as building an app, designing a website, or contributing to an open-source project on GitHub.

name: Self-Started Engineering Project
description: A self-directed project, such as building a robot, designing a circuit, or using a 3D printer to solve a problem.

name: Self-Started Creative Project (Film/Media)
description: A self-directed project, such as writing and directing a short film, starting a polished YouTube channel, or creating a video portfolio.

name: Part-Time Job
description: A standard part-time job. Demonstrates responsibility, time management, and customer service skills.

name: Part-Time Job (IT Help Desk)
description: A part-time job at a local business (e.g., Geek Squad) providing IT support. Demonstrates technical skills and problem-solving.

name: Local Business Internship
description: A general internship at a local Apex or Cary business, often focused on marketing, finance, or operations.

name: Start a Small Business
description: Starting and running your own small business (e.g., tutoring, lawn care, reselling). Demonstrates entrepreneurship and management.

name: Local Non-Profit Volunteering
description: Consistent volunteering at a local non-profit (e.g., Western Wake Crisis Ministry, local food bank, community center).

name: Local Writing/Publication
description: Writing for a local blog, community newsletter, or starting your own publication. Demonstrates writing skills and passion.

name: Personal Art Portfolio
description: Developing a high-quality, curated portfolio of 15-20 original works for college art program applications.

name: NC Museum of Natural Sciences Junior Curators
description: A competitive volunteer program for high school students to learn about museum science and gain hands-on experience.

name: WakeMed Junior Volunteer Program
description: A summer volunteer program for students (ages 15-18) to gain exposure to a hospital environment, assist staff, and interact with patients.

name: Physician Shadowing
description: Arranging to follow and observe a physician or other healthcare professional (e.g., dentist, PA) to understand their day-to-day work.

name: Government or Law Internship
description: An internship at a local law office, a congressperson's office, or with a local government department.

name: Volunteer for a Political Campaign
description: Volunteering for a local, state, or national political campaign. Involves canvassing, phone banking, or office work.

name: Camp Counselor or Tutor
description: A part-time or summer job that demonstrates leadership, teaching skills, and responsibility.

name: Volunteer with Local Schools
description: Volunteering as an assistant or tutor at a local elementary or middle school.

name: Family Responsibilities
description: Significant, long-term commitment to caring for family members (e.g., younger siblings, an elderly relative). Valued by colleges as a major EC.

name: Private Arts Lessons
description: Long-term, consistent private instruction in music, voice, theatre, or visual art to hone a craft.

name: Local Arts Performance
description: Auditioning for and performing in local productions, such as community theatre (e.g., Raleigh Little Theatre) or a regional orchestra.

name: Coastal Conservation
description: Summer or weekend volunteer work with a coastal organization focused on marine biology or environmental conservation.

name: Local Park Volunteering
description: Volunteering with a local (e.g., Town of Apex) or state park, often involving trail maintenance, nature center work, or environmental education.

name: Online Certification
description: Earning a professional certification online (e.g., Google IT Support, Adobe Certified Professional) to prove a specific skill.

name: Vet Clinic Volunteering/Shadowing
description: Volunteering or shadowing at a local veterinary clinic or animal shelter to gain hands-on experience with animal care.

name: EMS/Fire/Police Explorer Program
description: A local program for high school students to learn about public safety, emergency services, and criminal justice.

name: FAA Ground School Certification
description: Completing an online or in-person course to prepare for the FAA Private Pilot knowledge test. A key step for aspiring pilots.

name: Long-Term Service Commitment
description: A significant, long-term (1+ year) commitment to a single service organization (e.g., Food Bank, Crisis Ministry), often leading to a leadership role.

name: Biogen Community Lab
description: A state-of-the-art lab in RTP offering free, hands-on biotechnology workshops and summer programs for high school students.

name: Duke STAR Program
description: A selective 8-week summer program where students conduct hands-on research in STEM fields alongside Duke faculty and graduate students.

name: SAS Student Programs
description: SAS in Cary offers various student programs, including a competitive summer internship for students to work on real-world data science and software projects.

name: UNC Summer Health Professions Education Program (SHPEP)
description: A free, 6-week summer program for students interested in health careers. Provides academic enrichment, clinical exposure, and career development.

name: Duke Regional Hospital Volunteering
description: A high school volunteer program (ages 15+) for students to work in a hospital setting, assisting with guest services, patient transport, and clerical tasks.

name: UNC Medical Center Volunteering
description: A high school volunteer program (ages 16+) for students to gain experience in a major medical center. Summer and year-round options available.

name: Wake County Teen Court
description: A program where students serve as attorneys, clerks, and jurors in real cases involving first-time juvenile offenders. Excellent for pre-law.

name: Raleigh Little Theatre
description: A local community theatre that offers numerous opportunities for high school students to volunteer as actors, tech crew, or ushers.

name: NC Museum of History Volunteer
description: A volunteer program for high school students ('Tar Heel Junior Historian') to serve as program assistants and interpreters.

name: Marbles Kids Museum Volunteer
description: A 'Spark' volunteer program for teens (ages 13-17) to work in a museum environment, interacting with children and facilitating play-based learning.

name: Junior Achievement of Eastern NC
description: A program focused on financial literacy and entrepreneurship. High school students can participate in programs or volunteer to teach younger students.
